file_content.text: Hey! That Black Death guy is still killing my customers. Thanks for nothing.
I'm spreading the word that it's safe for my customers to come do business. Thanks for your help, my friend.
One of Imot's little buddies stopped by. Said he saw the Black Death packing up his camp. Nice job!
I made him see the error of his ways.
I'm a skilled negotiator.
I'll bet you did. Sounds like he's finished here for good.
For a guy called the "Black Death," he wasn't so tough.
He was a pushover.
Figures. Guys like that always fold when they meet somebody like you.
You're welcome.
I don't know what you said to the guy, but thanks!
I didn't break a sweat.
Well, you've still earned these credits. Best money I ever spent.
I wish the Black Death had paid for his crimes against my people, but I am grateful for your efforts.
It wasn't my call to execute him. That's someone else's duty.
I'm no lawman.
I didn't mean execution--but perhaps if he had lost his eyes and ears....
I did what I could.
Outsiders rarely do anything to help my kind. You are a very special being.
You'd better be.
I understand. You didn't do this for us. You did it for Var'soonta.
One of Imot's little buddies just stopped by. Said he saw you kill the Black Death. Pretty harsh.
He was too dangerous to leave in one piece.
It was the only way.
Yeah. There's something seriously wrong with a guy who randomly kills unarmed customers.
What do you care how I got rid of him?
So?
I don't. In fact, forget I even brought it up.
Horell was evil.
You must have ice water running through your veins.
Give me my credits.
Uh, sure, sure, sure. I've got your credits ready.
You punished the Black Death and avenged my people's slaughter. You will be celebrated at our campfires tonight.
Make sure you get my name right in your little folk songs.
That's nice.
We will.
My pleasure.
At least until another like him comes along. Next time, we must be ready.
I didn't do this for you.
I see. You care nothing for Evocii. You kill for profit.
That's enough, Imot. Get back to work scrubbing those broken power converters.
Here's your credits, my friend. Safe travels to you.
My Evocii customers are still hiding from that crazy Black Death. Put some sense into him, will you?
Choowahai, stranger. That's Evocii native speak for "hello."
You speak the Evocii language? Why bother?
Good for you, I suppose.
Ah, it's good for business. I can also say "have a nice day" and "death to the Hutts."
Do I look like an Evocii to you, moron?
What's that to me, idiot?
No offense intended, my well-armed friend.
I don't know much about these natives.
Evocii?
Not much to tell. This was the Evocii homeworld before the Hutts took over. Now it isn't.
Quite a junk collection you've got. Make it yourself?
What a dump.
Hey, this stuff is pure gold to Evocii. I mean, look at how they live.
Don't get a lot of visitors who aren't backwards savages. You come to the work camp looking for laborers?
Tell me about this work camp. Who runs it?
You in charge here?
Nobody, really. The Hutts gave the Evocii some land to keep them quiet. Catch is, they're expected to work for it.
I have other business. Just stopped here out of curiosity.
No.
Well good to meet you, then. Nice talking with someone who doesn't live in the mud, for a change.
You don't need to know.
Right you are. I spend so much time around these Evocii savages I forget my manners.
My name's Var'soonta, by the way. I deal salvage to the Evocii. Smelly work, but profitable.
How can these poor Evocii possibly afford to pay you?
Profitable? How?
They trade me gear they find out in the swamps. A lot of it's good stuff.
That's a sweet deal.
You'd be amazed what those natives will give up for my junk.
You sell trash to trash. Congratulations.
Big deal.
On Hutta, a credit's a credit. Doesn't matter how you get it or who gives it to you.
Most Evocii are decent, though not too bright. Like my little helper here. Say hello, Imot.
Welcome to Var'soonta's Many Treasures. Do you know the Black Death who slaughters my people?
Imot, I keep telling you, not every offworlder knows the Black Death! Ignore him, stranger. This isn't your problem.
This "Black Death"--is it a man or a beast?
"Black Death"?
A man, and that's not his real name. Evocii call him that because he wears black when he hunts them.
Sounds like there's trouble.
There's some crazy rich guy running around shooting Evocii. Big pain in the neck.
Sounds to me like you're losing valued customers.
No--it's yours.
It's true. Business is way down, lately.
The Black Death kills my people for sport. Butchers women and children.
He started out hunting hostile Evocii in the swamps, but now he's killing ones from the work camp. Having the time of his life.
Keeps their ears and teeth as trophies. If this slaughter keeps up, I might have to get a real job.
You know, I'll bet someone like you could convince this guy to quit. I'd sure make it worth your while.
If this guy doesn't take the hint, you want me to kill him?
What if he won't?
Hmm... violence is bad for business. Your call, though.
I'll gladly do it.
Fantastic. You just might save my business.
No thanks.
Are you sure? You just have to talk to the guy--easiest credits you'll ever make.
I'll look into it.
Great!
I'll expect a good reward.
My livelihood is worth a lot to me.
You're looking for a vehicle out in the swamps, surrounded by security droids. The Black Death guy doesn't like visitors.
You'll probably want to do something about his droids before you try talking to him. Good luck.
Enough! [Refuse quest]
All right, forget I asked! Imot, keep your mouth shut and scrub the slime off those power converters.
'Scuse me, but we have work to do.
Welcome to Var'soonta's Many Treasures. Wish I had treasures, but this junk's only useful to Evocii. Have a good day!
